title: Book printing and binding
content:
Hello everyone at Typophile!

This is my first post at Typophile. The question I´m asking it´s not typography related, but here it goes anyway.

I´ve designed a small book (it was my graduation course thesis) about typeface legibility and readability, and I would like to know if anyone knows about any company that offers services on very short runs of book printing and binding?

I live in Portugal, so the company must have a shipment service to Portugal.

Thanks very much.
author: Calabaça

comments.content:
The general term for this kind of short-run stuff is "print on demand"... tons of places offer it.

T

You can get this kind of book printing from an online service such as [Lulu.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021230217/http:/www.lulu.com/). [Acme Bookbinding](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021230217/http:/www.acmebook.com/) near Boston will give more personalized service.  
Both can ship internationally, but to a book printer, anything under 1000 copies is a very short run. If you plan to print several hundred copies, you may prefer to print them in Europe to avoid a very slow and/or expensive delivery. [IBT Global](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021230217/http:/www.integratedbook.com/index1.html) has a facility in London.

You can find print on demand in Lisbon or so. If not, and if you can go about with english, order from a US on demand provider. They do a pretty good job and shipping is a wonder of the 21st century. You can foofle all the info out the internet.

Salud! (y fuerza al canut)

Thanks for your answers!!!

I already found a UK company (Hollingworth & Moss Bookbinders) that offer such servive. I´m just waiting for prices.

Regards

Ricardo Calabaça
